p: The number of patients reviewed monthly at the hepatitis clinics fell substantially from January to April, 2020, by 71% in Burkina Faso, 95% in Tanzania, and 83% in The Gambia for new cases, and by 73% in Burkina Faso, 77% in Tanzania, and 89% in The Gambia for patients in follow-up ( appendix p 4). To exclude any annual seasonal effects, we compared the number of viral hepatitis cases (new patients and patients in follow-up) in 2020 against those seen during the same period last year (Jan 1 to April 30, 2019) in The Gambia and found no significant fluctuation in cases (data not shown).
